H0.text: Impermeable rock is the material that stops water when it seeps into the ground through permeable material.

H1.text: Bed rock is the layer that stops water seeping into the ground through permeable material.

H2.text: Lava is the material that water seeps into the ground through permeable material stops when it reaches.

H3.text: Coral is the material that water seeps into the ground through permeable material and stops when it reaches it.

A4.text: Aquitards are composed of layers of either clay or non-porous rock with low hydraulic conductivity.

A5.text: An aquiclude or aquifuge is a solid and impermeable region... the pressure of which could lead to the formation of a confined aquifer.
